1.text: The king’s heart is in the hand of the LORD, as the watercourses: He turneth it whithersoever He will.

2.text: Every way of a man is right in his own eyes; But the LORD weigheth the hearts.

3.text: To do righteousness and justice Is more acceptable to the LORD than sacrifice.

4.text: A haughty look, and a proud heart—The tillage of the wicked is sin.

5.text: The thoughts of the diligent tend only to plenteousness; But every one that is hasty hasteth only to want.

6.text: The getting of treasures by a lying tongue Is a vapour driven to and fro; they [that seek them] seek death.

7.text: The violence of the wicked shall drag them away; Because they refuse to do justly.

8.text: The way of man is froward and strange; But as for the pure, his work is right.

9.text: It is better to dwell in a corner of the housetop, Than in a house in common with a contentious woman.

10.text: The soul of the wicked desireth evil; His neighbour findeth no favour in his eyes.

11.text: When the scorner is punished, the thoughtless is made wise; And when the wise is instructed, he receiveth knowledge.

12.text: The Righteous One considereth the house of the wicked; Overthrowing the wicked to their ruin.

13.text: Whoso stoppeth his ears at the cry of the poor, He also shall cry himself, but shall not be answered.

14.text: A gift in secret pacifieth anger, And a present in the bosom strong wrath.

15.text: To do justly is joy to the righteous, But ruin to the workers of iniquity.

16.text: The man that strayeth out of the way of understanding Shall rest in the congregation of the shades.

17.text: He that loveth pleasure shall be a poor man; He that loveth wine and oil shall not be rich.

18.text: The wicked is a ransom for the righteous; And the faithless cometh in the stead of the upright.

19.text: It is better to dwell in a desert land, Than with a contentious and fretful woman.

20.text: There is desirable treasure and oil in the dwelling of the wise; But a foolish man swalloweth it up.

21.text: He that followeth after righteousness and mercy Findeth life, prosperity, and honour.

22.text: A wise man scaleth the city of the mighty, And bringeth down the stronghold wherein it trusteth.

23.text: Whoso keepeth his mouth and his tongue Keepeth his soul from troubles.

24.text: A proud and haughty man, scorner is his name, Even he that dealeth in overbearing pride.

25.text: The desire of the slothful killeth him; For his hands refuse to labour.

26.text: There is that coveteth greedily all the day long; But the righteous giveth and spareth not.

27.text: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination; How much more, when he bringeth it with the proceeds of wickedness?

28.text: A false witness shall perish; But the man that obeyeth shall speak unchallenged.

29.text: A wicked man hardeneth his face; But as for the upright, he looketh well to his way.

30.text: There is no wisdom nor understanding Nor counsel against the LORD.

31.text: The horse is prepared against the day of battle; But victory is of the LORD.
